seo.title: Andara vs Baseline Water: Comparison Protocol
seo.description: Step-by-step protocol for comparing Andara-treated water to baseline: controlled testing, time points, and parameter tracking.

sections.html:
Zone 2 • Protocol

Andara vs Baseline

Comparison Protocol — Side-by-Side Testing

The only way to know if something changes water is to compare it to unchanged water under the same conditions.

The Protocol

Setup

  1. Use identical containers (same material, size)
  2. Same source water, same temperature
  3. Split into two glasses: A (baseline), B (treated)
  4. Apply Andara to glass B only
  5. Place side by side, same environment

Measure

  • T0 — immediately after treatment
  • T30 — 30 minutes
  • T2h — 2 hours
  • T24h — 24 hours

Parameters

EC/TDS, ORP, pH, turbidity

Control Variables

  • Same containers
  • Same water source
  • Same room, same temperature
  • Same time elapsed
  • Same measurement sequence

The only difference should be the treatment applied.

Log & Share

Log Your Data → Submit to Community →
